trans-unit.source: Create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision or create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal; MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision or create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal; MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Create BizTalk Services using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Create BizTalk Services using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] To sign in to the Azure portal, you need an Azure account and Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] To sign in to the Azure portal, you need an Azure account and Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account within a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account within a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Free Trial](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=239738).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Free Trial](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=239738).

trans-unit.source: Create a BizTalk Service
trans-unit.target: Create a BizTalk Service

trans-unit.source: Depending on the Edition you choose, not all BizTalk Service settings may be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the Edition you choose, not all BizTalk Service settings may be available.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: In the bottom navigation pane, select **NEW**:
trans-unit.target: In the bottom navigation pane, select **NEW**:

trans-unit.source: ![Select the New button][NEWButton]
trans-unit.target: ![Select the New button][NEWButton]

trans-unit.source: Select **APP SERVICES** > **BIZTALK SERVICE** > **CUSTOM CREATE**:
trans-unit.target: Select **APP SERVICES** > **BIZTALK SERVICE** > **CUSTOM CREATE**:

trans-unit.source: ![Select BizTalk Service and select Custom Create][NewBizTalkService]
trans-unit.target: ![Select BizTalk Service and select Custom Create][NewBizTalkService]

trans-unit.source: Enter the BizTalk Service settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the BizTalk Service settings:

trans-unit.source: BizTalk service name
trans-unit.target: BizTalk service name

trans-unit.source: You can enter any name but be specific.
trans-unit.target: You can enter any name but be specific.

trans-unit.source: Some examples include:
trans-unit.target: Some examples include:

trans-unit.source: mycompany.biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: mycompany.biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: mycompanymyapplication.biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: mycompanymyapplication.biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: myapplication.biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: myapplication.biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: ".biztalk.windows.net" is automatically added to the name you enter.
trans-unit.target: ".biztalk.windows.net" is automatically added to the name you enter.

trans-unit.source: This creates a URL that is used to access your BizTalk Service, like https://myapplication.biztalk.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: This creates a URL that is used to access your BizTalk Service, like https://myapplication.biztalk.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: Edition
trans-unit.target: Edition

trans-unit.source: If you are in the testing/development phase, choose Developer.
trans-unit.target: If you are in the testing/development phase, choose Developer.

trans-unit.source: If you are in the production phase, use the BizTalk Services: Editions Chart to determine if Premium, Standard, or Basic is the correct choice for your business scenario.
trans-unit.target: If you are in the production phase, use the BizTalk Services: Editions Chart to determine if Premium, Standard, or Basic is the correct choice for your business scenario.

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Select the geographic region to host your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select the geographic region to host your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Domain URL
trans-unit.target: Domain URL

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: By default, the domain URL is YourBizTalkServiceName.biztalk.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: By default, the domain URL is YourBizTalkServiceName.biztalk.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: A custom domain can also be entered.
trans-unit.target: A custom domain can also be entered.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your domain is contoso, you can enter:
trans-unit.target: For example, if your domain is contoso, you can enter:

trans-unit.source: MyCompany.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: MyCompany.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: MyCompanyMyApplication.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: MyCompanyMyApplication.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: MyApplication.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: MyApplication.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: YourBizTalkServiceName.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: YourBizTalkServiceName.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: Select the NEXT arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the NEXT arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Storage and Database Settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Storage and Database Settings:

trans-unit.source: Monitoring/Archiving storage account
trans-unit.target: Monitoring/Archiving storage account

trans-unit.source: Select an existing storage account or create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing storage account or create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: If you create a new Storage account, enter the Storage Account Name.
trans-unit.target: If you create a new Storage account, enter the Storage Account Name.

trans-unit.source: Tracking database
trans-unit.target: Tracking database

trans-unit.source: If you use an existing Azure SQL Database, it cannot be used by another BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you use an existing Azure SQL Database, it cannot be used by another BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You need the login name and password entered when that Azure SQL Database Server was created.
trans-unit.target: You need the login name and password entered when that Azure SQL Database Server was created.

trans-unit.source: TIP Create the Tracking database and Monitoring/Archiving storage account in the same region as the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: TIP Create the Tracking database and Monitoring/Archiving storage account in the same region as the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the NEXT arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the NEXT arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Database settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Database settings:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected in the previous screen.
trans-unit.target: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected in the previous screen.

trans-unit.source: Enter a SQL Database name to be used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Enter a SQL Database name to be used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Server
trans-unit.target: Server

trans-unit.source: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected in the previous screen.
trans-unit.target: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected in the previous screen.

trans-unit.source: Select an existing SQL Database Server or create a new SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing SQL Database Server or create a new SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: Server login name
trans-unit.target: Server login name

trans-unit.source: Enter the login user name.
trans-unit.target: Enter the login user name.

trans-unit.source: Server login password
trans-unit.target: Server login password

trans-unit.source: Enter the login password.
trans-unit.target: Enter the login password.

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected.
trans-unit.target: Available when Create a new SQL Database instance is selected.

trans-unit.source: Select the geographic region to host your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Select the geographic region to host your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark to complete the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark to complete the wizard.

trans-unit.source: The progress icon appears:
trans-unit.target: The progress icon appears:

trans-unit.source: Progress icon displays when complete
trans-unit.target: Progress icon displays when complete

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Azure BizTalk Service is created and ready for your applications.
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Azure BizTalk Service is created and ready for your applications.

trans-unit.source: The default settings are sufficient.
trans-unit.target: The default settings are sufficient.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the default settings, select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the default settings, select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Additional settings are displayed in the [Dashboard, Monitor, and Scale tabs](biztalk-dashboard-monitor-scale-tabs.md) at the top.
trans-unit.target: Additional settings are displayed in the [Dashboard, Monitor, and Scale tabs](biztalk-dashboard-monitor-scale-tabs.md) at the top.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the state of the BizTalk Service, there are some operations that cannot be completed.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the state of the BizTalk Service, there are some operations that cannot be completed.

trans-unit.source: For a list of these operations, go to [BizTalk Services State Chart](biztalk-service-state-chart.md).
trans-unit.target: For a list of these operations, go to [BizTalk Services State Chart](biztalk-service-state-chart.md).

trans-unit.source: Post-provisioning steps
trans-unit.target: Post-provisioning steps

trans-unit.source: Install the certificate on a local computer
trans-unit.target: Install the certificate on a local computer

trans-unit.source: Add a production-ready certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a production-ready certificate

trans-unit.source: Get the Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Get the Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: Install the certificate on a local computer
trans-unit.target: Install the certificate on a local computer

trans-unit.source: As part of BizTalk Service provisioning, a self-signed certificate is created and associated with your BizTalk Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: As part of BizTalk Service provisioning, a self-signed certificate is created and associated with your BizTalk Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must download this certificate and install it on computers from where you either deploy BizTalk Service applications or send messages to a BizTalk Service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You must download this certificate and install it on computers from where you either deploy BizTalk Service applications or send messages to a BizTalk Service endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: Select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: Select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Dashboard** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Dashboard** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select **Download SSL Certificate**:
trans-unit.target: Select **Download SSL Certificate**:

trans-unit.source: ![Modify SSL Certificate][QuickGlance]
trans-unit.target: ![Modify SSL Certificate][QuickGlance]

trans-unit.source: Double-click the certificate and run through the wizard to install the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the certificate and run through the wizard to install the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you install the certificate under the **Trusted Root Certificate Authorities** store.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you install the certificate under the **Trusted Root Certificate Authorities** store.

trans-unit.source: Add a production-ready certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a production-ready certificate

trans-unit.source: The self-signed certificate that is automatically created when creating BizTalk Services is intended for use in development environments only.
trans-unit.target: The self-signed certificate that is automatically created when creating BizTalk Services is intended for use in development environments only.

trans-unit.source: For production scenarios, replace it with a production-ready certificate.
trans-unit.target: For production scenarios, replace it with a production-ready certificate.

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** tab, select **Update SSL Certificate**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** tab, select **Update SSL Certificate**.

trans-unit.source: Browse to your private SSL certificate (*CertificateName*.pfx) that includes your BizTalk Service name, enter the password, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Browse to your private SSL certificate (*CertificateName*.pfx) that includes your BizTalk Service name, enter the password, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: Get the Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Get the Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: Select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **BIZTALK SERVICES** in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, select **Connection Information**:
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, select **Connection Information**:

trans-unit.source: ![Select Connection Information][ACSConnectInfo]
trans-unit.target: ![Select Connection Information][ACSConnectInfo]

trans-unit.source: Copy the Access Control values.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Access Control values.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control namespace is automatically created for your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control namespace is automatically created for your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control values can be used with any application.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control values can be used with any application.

trans-unit.source: When Azure BizTalk Services is created, this Access Control namespace controls the authentication with your BizTalk Service deployment.
trans-unit.target: When Azure BizTalk Services is created, this Access Control namespace controls the authentication with your BizTalk Service deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the subscription or manage the namespace, select **ACTIVE DIRECTORY** in the left navigation pane and then select your namespace.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the subscription or manage the namespace, select **ACTIVE DIRECTORY** in the left navigation pane and then select your namespace.

trans-unit.source: The task bar lists your options.
trans-unit.target: The task bar lists your options.

trans-unit.source: Clicking **Manage** opens the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Clicking **Manage** opens the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Access Control Management Portal, the BizTalk Service uses **Service identities**:
trans-unit.target: In the Access Control Management Portal, the BizTalk Service uses **Service identities**:

trans-unit.source: ![ACS Service Identities in the Access Control Management Portal][ACSServiceIdentities]
trans-unit.target: ![ACS Service Identities in the Access Control Management Portal][ACSServiceIdentities]

trans-unit.source: The Access Control service identity is a set of credentials that allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with Access Control and receive a token.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control service identity is a set of credentials that allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with Access Control and receive a token.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The BizTalk Service uses **Owner** for the default service identity and the **Password** value.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The BizTalk Service uses **Owner** for the default service identity and the **Password** value.

trans-unit.source: If you use the Symmetric Key value instead of the Password value, the following error may occur.
trans-unit.target: If you use the Symmetric Key value instead of the Password value, the following error may occur.

trans-unit.source: *Could not connect to the Access Control Management Service account with the specified credentials*
trans-unit.target: *Could not connect to the Access Control Management Service account with the specified credentials*

trans-unit.source: [Managing Your ACS Namespace](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh674478.aspx) lists some guidelines and recommendations.
trans-unit.target: [Managing Your ACS Namespace](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh674478.aspx) lists some guidelines and recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Requirements explained
trans-unit.target: Requirements explained

trans-unit.source: These requirements do not apply to the Free Edition.
trans-unit.target: These requirements do not apply to the Free Edition.

trans-unit.source: What you need
trans-unit.target: What you need

trans-unit.source: Why you need it
trans-unit.target: Why you need it

trans-unit.source: Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: The subscription determines who can sign in to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The subscription determines who can sign in to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The Account holder creates the subscription at Azure Subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The Account holder creates the subscription at Azure Subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The Azure account can have multiple subscriptions and can be managed by anyone who is permitted.
trans-unit.target: The Azure account can have multiple subscriptions and can be managed by anyone who is permitted.

trans-unit.source: For example, your Azure account holder creates a subscription named BizTalkServiceSubscription and gives the BizTalk Administrators within your company (for example, ContosoBTSAdmins@live.com) access to this subscription.
trans-unit.target: For example, your Azure account holder creates a subscription named BizTalkServiceSubscription and gives the BizTalk Administrators within your company (for example, ContosoBTSAdmins@live.com) access to this subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the BizTalk Administrators sign in to the Azure portal and have full Administrator rights to all the hosted services in the subscription, including Azure BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the BizTalk Administrators sign in to the Azure portal and have full Administrator rights to all the hosted services in the subscription, including Azure BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Administrators are not the Azure account holders and therefore don't have access to any billing information.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Administrators are not the Azure account holders and therefore don't have access to any billing information.

trans-unit.source: Manage Subscriptions and Storage Accounts in the Azure portal provides more information.
trans-unit.target: Manage Subscriptions and Storage Accounts in the Azure portal provides more information.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Stores the tables, views, and stored procedures used by the BizTalk Service, including the Tracking data.
trans-unit.target: Stores the tables, views, and stored procedures used by the BizTalk Service, including the Tracking data.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Azure SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, or automatically create a new Server or Database.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Azure SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, or automatically create a new Server or Database.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Database scale is automatically configured.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Database scale is automatically configured.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the default scale is sufficient for a BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the default scale is sufficient for a BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Changing the scale impacts pricing.
trans-unit.target: Changing the scale impacts pricing.

trans-unit.source: See Accounts and Billing in Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: See Accounts and Billing in Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Azure SQL Server and Database, Azure Services is automatically enabled.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Azure SQL Server and Database, Azure Services is automatically enabled.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Service requires Azure Services be enabled.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Service requires Azure Services be enabled.

trans-unit.source: If you create a new Azure SQL Database on an existing Azure SQL Server, the firewall rules of the Server are not changed.
trans-unit.target: If you create a new Azure SQL Database on an existing Azure SQL Server, the firewall rules of the Server are not changed.

trans-unit.source: As a result, it's possible other Azure Services are not allowed access to the Server's databases.
trans-unit.target: As a result, it's possible other Azure Services are not allowed access to the Server's databases.

trans-unit.source: Azure Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Azure Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: Authenticates with Azure BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: Authenticates with Azure BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service, the Access Control namespace is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service, the Access Control namespace is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Gives access to tables, blobs, and queues used by your BizTalk Service to save the following:
trans-unit.target: Gives access to tables, blobs, and queues used by your BizTalk Service to save the following:

trans-unit.source: Log files that monitor the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Log files that monitor the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: The monitoring output is also displayed in the **Monitoring** tab in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The monitoring output is also displayed in the **Monitoring** tab in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: When creating an X12 or AS2 agreement between partners, you can enable the Archiving feature to store message properties.
trans-unit.target: When creating an X12 or AS2 agreement between partners, you can enable the Archiving feature to store message properties.

trans-unit.source: This data is saved in the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: This data is saved in the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Storage account or automatically create a new Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Storage account or automatically create a new Storage account.

trans-unit.source: The default Storage settings are sufficient for a BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The default Storage settings are sufficient for a BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.

trans-unit.source: These Keys control access to your Storage account.
trans-unit.target: These Keys control access to your Storage account.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: See Storage for more information.
trans-unit.target: See Storage for more information.

trans-unit.source: SSL private certificate
trans-unit.target: SSL private certificate

trans-unit.source: When an Azure BizTalk Service is created, an HTTPS URL that includes your BizTalk Service name is also created.
trans-unit.target: When an Azure BizTalk Service is created, an HTTPS URL that includes your BizTalk Service name is also created.

trans-unit.source: This URL is automatically configured to use a self-signed development-only certificate.
trans-unit.target: This URL is automatically configured to use a self-signed development-only certificate.

trans-unit.source: For production, you need a private SSL certificate.
trans-unit.target: For production, you need a private SSL certificate.

trans-unit.source: Important SSL Certificate Information
trans-unit.target: Important SSL Certificate Information

trans-unit.source: The certificate expiration date must be less than 5 years.
trans-unit.target: The certificate expiration date must be less than 5 years.

trans-unit.source: All private certificates require a password.
trans-unit.target: All private certificates require a password.

trans-unit.source: Know this password and as a best practice, share this password with your administrators.
trans-unit.target: Know this password and as a best practice, share this password with your administrators.

trans-unit.source: Self-signed certificates are used in a test/development environment.
trans-unit.target: Self-signed certificates are used in a test/development environment.

trans-unit.source: When using self-signed certificates, import the certificate to your Personal certificate store and the Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store.
trans-unit.target: When using self-signed certificates, import the certificate to your Personal certificate store and the Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store.

trans-unit.source: When sending the production certificate request to your certification authority, give the following certificate properties:
trans-unit.target: When sending the production certificate request to your certification authority, give the following certificate properties:

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Key Usage: At a minimum, Azure BizTalk Services requires Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Key Usage: At a minimum, Azure BizTalk Services requires Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Common Name: Enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your Azure BizTalk Service URL.
trans-unit.target: Common Name: Enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your Azure BizTalk Service URL.

trans-unit.source: See Create a BizTalk Service in this article.
trans-unit.target: See Create a BizTalk Service in this article.

trans-unit.source: A new or different certificate can be added after the BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: A new or different certificate can be added after the BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure BizTalk Service, the **Hybrid Connections** tab is available:
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure BizTalk Service, the **Hybrid Connections** tab is available:

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections Tab
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections Tab

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections are used to connect an Azure website or Azure mobile service to any on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, Mobile Services, and most custom Web Services.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections are used to connect an Azure website or Azure mobile service to any on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, Mobile Services, and most custom Web Services.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections and the BizTalk Adapter Service are different.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections and the BizTalk Adapter Service are different.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Adapter Service is used to connect Azure BizTalk Services to an on-premises Line of Business (LOB) system.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Adapter Service is used to connect Azure BizTalk Services to an on-premises Line of Business (LOB) system.

trans-unit.source: See [Hybrid Connections](integration-hybrid-connection-overview.md) to learn more, including creating and managing Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: See [Hybrid Connections](integration-hybrid-connection-overview.md) to learn more, including creating and managing Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that a BizTalk Service is created, familiarize yourself with the different [BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor and Scale tabs](biztalk-dashboard-monitor-scale-tabs.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that a BizTalk Service is created, familiarize yourself with the different [BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor and Scale tabs](biztalk-dashboard-monitor-scale-tabs.md).

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service is ready for your applications.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service is ready for your applications.

trans-unit.source: To start creating applications, go to [Azure BizTalk Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=235197).
trans-unit.target: To start creating applications, go to [Azure BizTalk Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=235197).

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md)
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md)

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: State Chart](biztalk-service-state-chart.md)
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: State Chart](biztalk-service-state-chart.md)

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore](biztalk-backup-restore.md)
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore](biztalk-backup-restore.md)
